intro: Ticorea foetida, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and hairy leaves. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its strong, unpleasant odor, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
